message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
private List<SomeType> removeDuplicates(List<SomeType> listWithDuplicates) {
    Set<String> set = new HashSet<>();
    Iterator<SomeType> iterator = listWithDuplicates.iterator();
    while (iterator.hasNext()) {
        SomeType someType = iterator.next();
        if (!set.add(someType.getFirstConstructorArg())) {
            iterator.remove();
        }
    }
    return listWithDuplicates;
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code uses an Iterator to traverse the list and a HashSet to keep track of the unique first constructor arguments. If the first constructor argument of the current object is already in the set, the object is removed from the list. If it's not in the set, it's added to the set. This way, only the first object with each unique first constructor argument remains in the list.
